alert.note: Alert for Crockett; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:22PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Crockett and western Sutton Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 520 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms in rural southeastern Crockett County, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... I-10 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line, The Intersection Of I- 10 And Ranch Road 1989, Us-277 Near The Sutton- Schleicher County Line and The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 368 and 398. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
